page.title: 02Dunnington Primary School
page.content: Dunnington School has 40 pupils. They are taught in 2 classes; the infants by Mrs. Longstaffe and the juniors by the headmaster, Mr. Reeks. Mr. Reeks has taught at the school for 12 years and is retiring at the end of this school year. The school was built in 1876, on land given by the Marquess of Hertford. The school did not have a playing field until 1932. Before 1953 the lavatories were 2 buckets inside 2 huts, then Elsan toilets were installed. It wasn't until 1960 that hot and cold running water and proper flush toilets were put in. A kitchen and staff room were also added at this time. A new headmistress, Mrs. M. Hood, has been appointed this term. She is coming to us from Lapworth Primary School.
